text: Where there is no wine there is no love.
author: Euripides

text: Whoso neglects learning in his youth, Loses the past and is dead for the future.
author: Euripides

text: Friends show their love in times of trouble...
author: Euripides

text: Silence is true wisdom's best reply.
author: Euripides

text: Danger gleams like sunshine to a brave man's eyes.
author: Euripides

text: Talk sense to a fool and he calls you foolish.
author: Euripides

text: There is just one life for each of us: our own.
author: Euripides

text: I have found power in the mysteries of thought.
author: Euripides

text: Judge a tree from its fruit, not from its leaves.
author: Euripides

text: To a father growing old nothing is dearer than a daughter.
author: Euripides

text: There is the sky, which is all men's together...
author: Euripides

text: When a good man is hurt all who would be called good must suffer with him.
author: Euripides

text: Impudence is the worst of all human diseases.
author: Euripides

text: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
author: Euripides

text: Youth is the best time to be rich, and the best time to be poor.
author: Euripides

text: Chance fights ever on the side of the prudent.
author: Euripides

text: Oh, what a power is motherhood, possessing A potent spell. All women alike Fight fiercely for a child.
author: Euripides

text: Question everything. Learn something. Answer nothing.
author: Euripides

text: Often a noble face hides filthy ways.
author: Euripides

text: Ten soldiers wisely led will beat a hundred without a head.
author: Euripides

text: There is just one life for each of us: our own
author: Euripides

text: Noble fathers have noble children.
author: Euripides

text: To a father growing old, nothing is dearer than a daughter.
author: Euripides

text: Experience, travel â€“ these are as education in themselves.
author: Euripides

text: Ten soldiers lead wisely will beat a hundred without a head.
author: Euripides

text: It's not beauty but fine qualities, my girl, that keep a husband.
author: Euripides

text: He is not a lover who does not love forever.
author: Euripides

text: The best and safest thing is to keep a balance in your life, acknowledge the great powers around us and in us. If you can do that, and live that way, you are really a wise man.
author: Euripides

text: The new-come stepmother hates the children born to a first wife.
author: Euripides

text: Better a sepent than a stepmother!
author: Euripides

text: Real friendship is shown in times of trouble; prosperity is full of friends.
author: Euripides

text: Cowards do not count in battle; they are there, but not in it.
author: Euripides

text: Better a serpent than a stepmother!
author: Euripides

text: He who believes needs no explanation.
author: Euripides

text: Let a man accept his destiny, No pity and no tears.
author: Euripides

text: Out of some little thing, too free a tongue can make an outrageous wrangle.
author: Euripides

text: Youth is the best time to be rich; and the best time to be poor.
author: Euripides

text: The wisest men follow their own direction.
author: Euripides

text: Enough is abundance to the wise.
author: Euripides

text: Experience, travel these are as education in themselves
author: Euripides

text: Sound judgment, with discernment, is the best of seers.
author: Euripides

text: Sanity brings pain but madness is a vile thing.
author: Euripides

text: The divine power moves with difficulty, but at the same time surely.
author: Euripides

text: Sound judgement, with discernment is the best of seers.
author: Euripides

text: Friendship doubles your joys, and divides your sorrows.
author: Euripides

text: Authority is never without hate.
author: Euripides

text: Wealth stays with us a little moment if at all: only our characters are steadfast, not our gold.
author: Euripides

text: Mighty is geometry; joined with art, resistless.
author: Euripides

text: Wrath brings mortal men their gravest hurt.
author: Euripides

text: In this world second thoughts, it seems, are best.
author: Euripides

text: The ways of the gods are long, but in the end they are not without strength.
author: Euripides

text: God gives each his due at the time allotted.
author: Euripides

text: The wavering mind is but a base possession.
author: Euripides

text: The daughters of Sparta are never at home! They mingle with the young men in wrestling matches.
author: Euripides

text: When a good man is hurt, all who would be called good must suffer with him.
author: Euripides

text: A great obstacle to happiness is to anticipate too great a happiness.
author: Euripides

text: Man's best possession is a sympathetic wife.
author: Euripides

text: In the hands of vicious men, a mob will do anything. But under good leaders it's quite a different story.
author: Euripides

text: O lady, nobility is thine, and thy form is the reflection of thy nature!
author: Euripides

text: A sweet thing, for whatever time, to revisit in dreams the dear dad we have lost.
author: Euripides

text: When one with honeyed words but evil mind persuades the mob, great woes befall the state.
author: Euripides

text: The mob gets out of hand, runs wild, worse than raging fire, while the man who stands apart is called a coward.
author: Euripides

text: Mobs in their emotions are much like children, subject to the same tantrums and fits of fury.
author: Euripides

text: The stillest tongue can be the truest friend.
author: Euripides

text: My tongue swore, but my mind was still unpledged.
author: Euripides

text: When a man's stomach is full it makes no difference whether he is rich or poor.
author: Euripides

text: Zeus hates busybodies and those who do too much.
author: Euripides

text: Second thoughts are ever wiser.
author: Euripides

text: Do not mistake the rule of force for true power. Men are not shaped by force.
author: Euripides

text: In case of dissension, never dare to judge till you've heard the other side.
author: Euripides

text: Life is a short affair; We should try to make it smooth, and free from strife.
author: Euripides

text: A sharp-tempered woman, or, for that matter, a man, Is easier to deal with than the clever type who holds her tongue.
author: Euripides

text: Short is the joy that guilty pleasure brings.
author: Euripides

text: If we could be twice young and twice old we could correct all our mistakes.
author: Euripides

text: One loyal friend is worth ten thousand relatives.
author: Euripides

text: Human misery must somewhere have a stop; there is no wind that always blows a storm.
author: Euripides

text: Mere cleverness is not wisdom.
author: Euripides

text: I know indeed what evil I intend to do, but stronger than all my afterthoughts is my fury, fury that brings upon mortals the greatest evils.
author: Euripides

text: Wealth stays with us a little moment if at all. Only our characters are steadfast, not our gold.
author: Euripides

text: Among mortals second thoughts are wisest.
author: Euripides

text: The day is for honest men, the night for thieves.
author: Euripides

text: My tongue swore, but my mind's unsworn.
author: Euripides

text: Slow but sure moves the might of the gods.
author: Euripides

text: To an old father, nothing is more sweet than a daughter. Boys are more spirited, but their ways are not so tender.
author: Euripides

text: Necessity is harsh. Fate has no reprieve.
author: Euripides

text: Toil, says the proverb, is the sire of fame.
author: Euripides

text: Love distills desire upon the eyes, love brings bewitching grace into the heart.
author: Euripides

text: Neither earth nor ocean produces a creature as savage and monstrous as woman.
author: Euripides

text: To persevere, trusting in what hopes one has, is courage in a man. The coward despairs.
author: Euripides

text: He who submits to fate without complaint is wise.
author: Euripides

text: There is no harbor of peace from the changing waves of joy and despair.
author: Euripides

text: This is slavery, not to speak one's thoughts.
author: Euripides

text: There is in the worst of fortune the best chances of a happy change.
author: Euripides

text: Every man is like the company he keeps.
author: Euripides
